greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of fixed points in planted trees with n nodes.
comment: The associated triangle H_{p,j}, p >= 1, 1 <= j <= p, a(n) = Sum_{j=1..p} j*H_{p,j}, row sums in A001678, starts:
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Probability that a point of a tree is fixed, Math. Proc. Camb. Phil. Soc. 85 (1979) 407-415.
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
Index entries for sequences related to trees
maple: for p from 1 to pmax do
for j from 1 to p do
for p from 0 to pmax do
for j from 1 to p do
mathematica: Hxy [x_, y_, pMax_, hxyinit_] := If [pMax == 0, x y, pp = 1; For[p = 1, p <= pMax, p++, t = 1; For[j = 1, j <= p, j++, t = t(1 + x^p y^j + Sum[x^(k*p), {k, 2, pMax + 1}])^Hpj[hxyinit, p, j]]; pp = pp t]; x*y* pp/(1 + x y)];

Reap[For[pMax = 2, pMax <= terms - 1, pMax++, Print["pMax = ", pMax]; sx = Series[Hxy[x, y, pMax, hxy], {x, 0, pMax + 2}] // Normal; sy = Series[sx, {y, 0, pMax + 2}]; hxy = sy // Normal; For[p = 0, p <= pMax, p++, Ap = 0; For[j = 1, j <= p, j++, Ap = Ap + j Hpj[hxy, p, j]]; If[pMax == terms - 1, Print[Ap]; Sow[Ap]]]]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 22 2020, after _R. J. Mathar_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 13 2019
